jibe.sdk.client.videosharing
Class VideoSharingService

java.lang.Object
  jibe.sdk.client.JibeServiceBase<IVideoSharing>
      jibe.sdk.client.videosharing.VideoSharingService

public class VideoSharingService
extends JibeServiceBase<IVideoSharing>

An RCS-e video-sharing service. Video-sharing is a unidirectional, real-time video-streaming session, between two IP end-points.

Currently, this is implemented only in order to provide RCS-e compliance.

VideoSharingService

public VideoSharingService(Context context,
                           JibeServiceListener listener)
Constructor.

Parameters:
context - The application context.
listener - The callback function that will be used to notify the application, once a connection to the service has been estabished. See JibeServiceBase.connect().
Method Detail

getActiveSessions

public long[] getActiveSessions()
                         throws JibeServiceException
Gets the list of sessions currently being managed by the video-sharing service.

Returns:
An array of session IDs (or an empty array, if there are no active sessions).
Throws:
JibeServiceException

shareLiveVideo

public VideoSharingResult shareLiveVideo(int communityId,
                                         java.lang.String destinationUserIdentifier,
                                         CameraMediaSource source)
                                  throws JibeServiceException
Initiate a new video-sharing session, with the remote party specified by the Android raw contact ID

Parameters:
communityId - Identifier for the community that the contact belongs to.
destinationUserIdentifier - An identifier for the user, which is valid within the specified community.
source - The video data source (the Jibe Realtime Engine). A CameraMediaSource implementation, to capture frames from the camera.
Returns:
A Jibe Service result object for the session-creation operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException - in the case of errors when communicating with the service.

acceptVideoSharingSession

public VideoSharingResult acceptVideoSharingSession(long videoSessionId,
                                                    VideoRenderer videoSink)
                                             throws JibeServiceException
Accept an incoming video session. See terminateVideoSharingSession(long) for how to reject an incoming session.

Parameters:
videoSessionId - The identifier of the incoming video-sharing session.
videoSink - A video sink, which implements decoding and rendering of the incoming video. The SDK provides the VideoRenderer implementation, to render the video to the display.
Returns:
A result object, containing information on the session-acceptance operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException - in the case of errors when communicating with the service.

terminateVideoSharingSession

public VideoSharingResult terminateVideoSharingSession(long videoSessionId)
                                                throws JibeServiceException
Terminate an active video-sharing session, or reject an incoming session request.

Parameters:
videoSessionId - The ID of the session to terminate.
Returns:
result An object containing information on the session-termination operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException - in the case of errors when communicating with the service.

updateVideoSource

public VideoSharingResult updateVideoSource(long videoSessionId,
                                            CameraMediaSource videoSource)
                                     throws JibeServiceException
Updates the camera source for a video sharing session. If the session is receive only - this has no effect.

Parameters:
videoSessionId - The ID of the session to update
videoSource - The updated camera source
Returns:
object containing information on the session update operation.
Throws:
JibeServiceException

updateVideoSink

public VideoSharingResult updateVideoSink(long videoSessionId,
                                          VideoRenderer videoSink)
                                   throws JibeServiceException
Updates the renderer for incoming remote video. If the session is send only - this has no effect.

Parameters:
videoSessionId - The ID of the session to update
videoSink - The updated video sink
Returns:
Throws:
JibeServiceException

getVideoQualityLevel

public int getVideoQualityLevel(long videoSessionId)
                         throws JibeServiceException
Returns the current quality level of the video share/video call. This is determined by statistics from the RTP stack regarding packet loss and the current quality level selected by the bitrate adaptation scheme.

Returns:
An integer from 0 (worst) to 6 (best) indicating the quality level or QUALITY_LEVEL_UNDEFINED
Throws:
JibeServiceException

disposeOfAllVideo

public void disposeOfAllVideo()
Disposes of all currently ongoing native video (Video Sharing related or otherwise). Should not be used if there any references to the native video! Use at your own risk!
